title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected. When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the 'defaultValue' field, such as '55/66/9999', the invalid value is accepted. As a result, the following definition shows up in the report design: <parameters><scalarparameter name="dateParam1"><property name="dataType">dateTime</property><property name="allowBlank">false</property><property name="format">Unformatted</property><property name="controlType">textbox</property><expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters>. There are two problems here: (1) The model should have stored a 'dateTime' type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/]), which is locale-independent, to ensure portability.
OB: When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is accepted in the 'defaultValue' field.
EB: When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', should be rejected in the 'defaultValue' field.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'defaultValue' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Save the report design.
5. Observe that the invalid date value is accepted and stored in the report parameter definition.
